content: व्रतः --तं [व्रज्-घ जस्य तः] {@--1@} A religious act of devotion or austerity, vowed observance, a vow in general; अभ्यस्यतीव व्रतमासिधारं <ls>R. 13. 67</ls>, <ls n="R.">2. 4</ls>, <ls n="R. 2.">25</ls>; (there are several {%vratas%} enjoined in the different Purāṇas; but their number cannot be said to be fixed, as new ones, {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} सत्यनारायणव्रत, are being added every day.) {@--2@} A vow, promise, resolve; सोऽभूद् भग्नव्रतः शत्रूनुद्धृत्य प्रतिरोपयन् <ls>R. 17. 42</ls>; so सत्यव्रत, पुण्यव्रत, दृढव्रत &c. {@--3@} Object of devotion or faith, devotion; as in पतिव्रता (पतिर्व्रतं यस्याः सा); यांति देवव्रता देवान् पितॄन् यांति पितृव्रताः <ls>Bg. 9. 25.</ls> {@--4@} A rite, an observance, practice, as in अर्कव्रत q v. {@--5@} Mode of life, course of conduct; <ls>Ś. 5. 27.</ls> {@--6@} An ordinance, a law, rule. {@--7@} Sacrifice. {@--8@} An act, a deed, work. {@--9@} A design, plan.
